references.reason: This paper introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), a foundational model for the text-guided diffusion models used in image editing, forming the basis of the inversion methods discussed.
This paper introduces denoising diffusion implicit models (DDIM), a key algorithm used for inverting images into the latent space, which is a crucial step in the image editing process described.
This paper proposes improvements to DDPMs, leading to higher-quality image generation and impacting the image editing methods used in the paper.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces high-resolution image synthesis using latent diffusion models, a significant advancement directly relevant to high-quality image editing.

references.paper_title: Photorealistic text-to-image diffusion models with deep language understanding
references.reason: This paper presents a state-of-the-art text-to-image diffusion model, which is highly relevant to the text-guided image editing techniques explored and compared in the current work.
